snippet: Only one member of the Sullivan family survived the fire that engulfed their two-story home early Tuesday in Putnam County.
abstract: House fire in Carmel, NY, kills Larchmont Police Captain Thomas Sullivan Sr, his wife Donna and daughters Meaghan and Mairead; Sullivan's 20-year-old son Thomas Sullivan Jr survives by escaping through the garage. Photo (M)a
lead_paragraph: CARMEL, N.Y. -- As fire consumed the home on Wyndham Lane here early Tuesday, it was not any of the eight fire alarms that roused Thomas Sullivan Jr. It was, he would say later, the screams of warning from his father. The father, Thomas Sullivan Sr., 49, a police captain in Larchmont, N.Y., did not get out of the burning house in time. He stayed back in the two-story residence where his wife, Donna, 48, and daughters Meaghan, 18 and Mairead, 13, remained in their bedrooms.

headline.main: Fire Kills Police Captain, His Wife and Two Daughters
